page.title: 16 TRANSPORT
page.content: Some time ago there was a{tram {line}carrying{stone}from Monkton Farleigh mines to the Bath to London {railway line}near Box Bridge.There was a{toll house}near{The Old Jockey}at Kingsdown because the London to Bath road went over Kingsdown.The{main {roads}in our area are Bath-London (A4) and Box-Melksham,(A365).We have one "B" road in our area,and that is Corsham-Bradford (B3109).We have one {main railway line}in our area,this is on the north west side.It goes from Bath to London.The one line of{pylons we have goes east to west over {farmland}at Kingsdown and follows some of the ancient Roman Road.The{oil pipe {lines}from Fawley in Southampton to South Wales also lie under farmland. There are 7{bus journeys}a week through Monkton carrying children to school and adults to Bath.
